fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Enlargement, Justice and Fundamental Rights, External Relations, Borders and Security
head_office_address: Rue de la Croix de Fer, 67
eu_initiatives: Effective Justice Systems, Justice Scorebaord, Rule of Law recommendations Poland
organisation_name: European Network of Councils for the Judiciary (ENCJ)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership: ENCJ is an institutional observer at the European Law Institute. It has also signed an MoU with the European Judicial Training Network.
relevant_communication: Bi-annual survey among judges to measure their independence. Report on Independence and Accountability mapping challenges in national justice systems.
goals__remit: Our aim is to improve cooperation between, and good mutual understanding amongst, the Councils for the Judiciary  and the members of the Judiciary of the European Union (or candidate) Member States. Within the framework of the creation of the European Area of freedom, security and justice, the objectives of the Association are co-operation between members and the analysis of and information on the structures and competencies of members and exchanges between the members ; the exchange of experience in relation to how the judiciary is organised and how it functions; the provision of expertise, experience and proposals to European Union institutions and other national and international organisations.
